2024-adac-test-bests-worsts-huge-fails-p.title: What happened on 2024 ADAC test and what are ADAC, Swedish Plus test and ECE R129 at all?
2024-adac-test-bests-worsts-huge-fails-p.subtitle: Parents 1x1, that saves your baby's life
2024-adac-test-bests-worsts-huge-fails-p.intro:
What is the ADAC test? What is Swedish Plus test? And ECE R129/03? ECE R44/04? One of them? Maybe ADAC sounds familiar a bit. Why are these all of them important? 

 Because in 2024 one of the ADAC tested car seat is thrown through the vehicle in scenarios of frontal crash tests. Umm, What the heck, right?
2024-adac-test-bests-worsts-huge-fails-p.intro2: Choosing a car seat for our baby is not an easy task, but the German ADAC and the Swedish Plus Test can be of great help. When a family chooses a car seat, the needs that arise are usually quite similar and categorizable. We want our child's car seat to be primarily safe, comfortable, and long-lasting, as well as practical, and at the same time, not to cost a fortune.
2024-adac-test-bests-worsts-huge-fails-p.what-is-it-for-title: Important note for readers who tend to quit in the middle of an article
2024-adac-test-bests-worsts-huge-fails-p.what-is-it-for: Perhaps one of the most surprising facts for parents is that child car seats have an expiration date, known as the 'expiry period.' This expiry period exists because the materials used in child car seats can age, causing their behavior to change over time. A perfect example of this is plastic, which tends to become stiffer with age and may not absorb forces from a collision as it should. It's essential for everyone to consider this when purchasing a used car seat. While buying a high-quality car seat is a clear choice for safety, it's even more costly to compromise on safety when it comes to our children's well-being during car journeys.  Another fact that if a family is expecting their third child, it's highly likely that the first child car seat they purchased will no longer be suitable, as its expiry period has likely passed. The simplest way to address this issue is to set a reminder in our calendars a few years after purchasing the seat, reminding us when its expiry period is due. If you are into to buy a used car seat, it's crucial to remove the cover, check the purchase year, and find the manufacturing year on the seat for any visible signs of damage. Nevertheless, when purchasing a used seat, one can never be entirely sure whether the car in which it was previously used was involved in even a minor accident, which could affect the seat's future performance in a potential real-life collision.
2024-adac-test-bests-worsts-huge-fails-p.pros-title: What certifications and tests exist for child car seats?
pros-descr: The ADAC (Allgemeiner Deutscher Automobil-Club) is a German automobile club, a highly esteemed organization. This club conducts various tests, including those on child car seats, aiming to help parents navigate through the tremendous amount of options available. Safety, ergonomics, materials used in manufacturing, and ease of cleaning are among the key criteria evaluated in these tests. By averaging the scores of these characteristics, a rating between 1.5 and 5.5 is obtained.

The VTI and NTF (National Society for Road Safety) introduced the Plus Test in Sweden in 2009. The Plus Test sets particularly strict test requirements and is an additional test that is voluntary for car child seat manufacturers. Since an update to the test protocol in 2023, no forward-facing car child seats can undergo the test. The fundamental idea behind the Plus Test is that no child in a car child seat recommended by the Plus Test should ever suffer a dangerous, or even life-threatening, injury due to a collision. 

 The Swedish Plus Test is so rigorous that only rear-facing car seats can meet its standards. Prior to 2011, tests did not assess harmful substances, whereas from 2015 onwards, usability and ergonomics were the sole focus.

ECE R44 04 is the older European approval standard that is being phased out. Child seats with this certification can still be used, but new child seats will only be approved under the new standard (R-129), as ECE R44/04 will be phased out from September 2024. 

 It's not tested for side impact and based on the child's weight.

The new European Union standard gradually replacing the ECE R44 standard. The i-Size standard has stricter safety requirements, including side-impact testing and mandatory use of ISOFIX. 

 In June 2013, the i-Size ECE R129 standard came into effect, elevating child car seat safety to a new level. 
 The new regulation imposes mandatory safety requirements for child car seats, providing enhanced protection in the event of an accident. Certain safety expectations, now considered essential, were not compulsory under the ECE R44/04 standard, which has been in place since 2005. Manufacturers could choose whether to incorporate these advanced protections or settle for standard quality. 

 The need for the new standard arose due to the shortcomings of the old standard and the advancements in car manufacturing, child car seat design, and safety technology that made it both possible and necessary. 

 Why was the new i-Size standard created then? in short: avoid human error (= parent error) 

 -Too many children died in car accidents. The leading cause of child fatalities is car accidents. Although the number of child deaths has decreased, in Europe, 10 children still died on the roads every week, and approximately 1150 are injured. (Sources: WHO (2007), EEVC Working Group 18 Report (February 2006). Survey in 12 European countries among children aged 0–14 (2003)). Since than it has improved a lot. Children have the lowest mortality rate compared to other age-groups, and the mortality rate has also decreased the most out of all age groups over the last decade. 
 The absolute number of road fatalities among children between 2011 and 2020 decreased by 47%, from 733 fatalities in 2011 to 386 fatalities in 2020. As the total number of road fatalities was decreasing less rapidly, their relative share decreased slightly. Within the group of children, the largest decrease in fatalities could be observed among the age-group of 5–9 year olds.  
 In terms of transport mode, children had a very high death toll among the most vulnerable modes of transport: 32% of children killed were pedestrians, 13% were cyclists. These figures are EU averages but there are much higher percentages in a number of EU countries.  
 In Romania and Greece, more than one in two fatalities among children was a pedestrian. In the Netherlands, 47% of fatalities among children were cyclists.The differences between the percentages for children and all fatalities reflect the mobility behaviour of children. link: https://road-safety.transport.ec.europa.eu/document/download/7f00b402-9aa2-44c7-b3c0-aaa6f81e0abd_en?filename=ff_children_20220706.pdf 

 - ISOFIX is needed since many child car seats are improperly installed. Properly securing a child car seat with the car's seatbelt can be too lengthy and complicated for many parents, leading to 27% of parents installing the seat incorrectly. To address this, the best solution is ISOFIX. The rate of incorrect installation drops to just 4% with ISOFIX seats. The new i-Size ECE R129 standard requires child seats to be ISOFIX-compatible, as the standard mandates ISOFIX. However using ISOFIX does not mean it's safer then using belt properly. 
 Many older cars on the road lack ISOFIX. While ISOFIX has become more common in cars manufactured after 2006–2007, it was often an optional feature. However, in cars produced from January 2011 onwards, ISOFIX is standard equipment. 

 - Another huge issue is that parents switch to larger car seats too soon. 

 - High incidence of side impacts. 25% of car accidents involve side impacts. Independent crash tests long focused only on frontal impacts, as none of the ECE R44 standards (from ECE R44/01–02–03 to the ECE R44/04 in effect since 2005) required side impact protection systems or testing protocols. The new ECE R129 i-Size standard introduced the necessity for side impact tests. i-Size car seats now require side protection systems, particularly for the head, neck, and hips, making such tests possible.
The Austrian automobile club's test, similar to ADAC, evaluates child seats based on several aspects, such as safety, handling, ergonomics, and environmental considerations.
2024-adac-test-bests-worsts-huge-fails-p.dimension-title: Best car seats for babys in 2024 based on ADAC
2024-adac-test-bests-worsts-huge-fails-p.differences:
In the latest child seat evaluation (2024), ADAC rigorously assessed 24 seats for safety, usability, ergonomics, and pollutant levels. While there are commendable models available in every size category, two seats were rated as 'unsatisfactory' due to pollutant contamination. 

 - 24 child seats across various sizes were tested, 

 - For babys, Nuna Pipa urbn with 1.6, Cybex Cloud G i-Size installed via Base G with 1.8, Lionelo Astrid i-Size installed via Astrid i-Size Base with 1.8, Avionaut Cosmo installed via IQ Base 2.0 C Base with 2.0 ADAC result.
2024-adac-test-bests-worsts-huge-fails-p.end-title: Worst car seats in 2024 based on ADAC
2024-adac-test-bests-worsts-huge-fails-p.end:
The cover material of the Silver Cross Discover i-Size contains the pollutant DPHP , which can damage the thyroid and pituitary gland. In the safety category, this seat only received a satisfactory rating, and the poor rating of the pollutant content explains the ADAC's rating of 4.8. 

 The second seat rated 'poor', Peg Perego Viaggio Twist + Base Twist, failed completely in a frontal crash , meaning that there is an acute risk of injury for the child: in the event of an impact, the seat is thrown through the vehicle! Due to the serious safety defects, the ADAC advises against using the Peg Perego Viaggio Twist + Base Twist in any case . In addition, the cover material is also contaminated, which resulted in the ADAC rating of 5.5 . The flame retardant TCPP detected there is suspected of being carcinogenic. 

 Video about the frontal crash test: https://youtube.com/shorts/FKLE7wVk-uc?si=sTuvCsYNfLAcSuY5 

 source: https://www.adac.de/rund-ums-fahrzeug/ausstattung-technik-zubehoer/kindersitze/kindersitztest/kindersitz-vergleichstest-2024/
2024-adac-test-bests-worsts-huge-fails-p.final: I hope you've enjoyed this review. Let's get strollin'...

maxi-cosi-jade-carrycot-car-seat-3way-fi.title:
Maxi Cosi Jade

Can a carrycot be as safe as a car seat for our newborn?
maxi-cosi-jade-carrycot-car-seat-3way-fi.intro:
When it comes to the safety and comfort of your newborn, the Maxi-Cosi Jade car seat stands out as a premier choice. Known for its innovative design and advanced safety features, the Jade offers a unique solution for parents seeking the best for their little ones. In this article, we will delve into the features, benefits, and potential drawbacks of the Maxi-Cosi Jade car seat to help you make an informed decision. 

 The Maxi-Cosi Jade is an award-winning car seat designed specifically for newborns up to approximately six months old, or 0-70 cm in height. It combines the safety standards of a car seat with the comfort of a carrycot, making it an ideal choice for parents who prioritize both safety and convenience.
maxi-cosi-jade-carrycot-car-seat-3way-fi.end: The Maxi-Cosi Jade car seat is a top-tier choice for parents seeking unparalleled safety and comfort for their newborns. Its innovative design, coupled with advanced safety features and versatile usability, make it a standout product in the market. While it may come with a higher price tag and a limited usage period, the benefits it offers in terms of safety and convenience are well worth the investment. If you are looking for a car seat that prioritizes your baby's well-being and provides ease of use, the Maxi-Cosi Jade is an excellent option to consider.
maxi-cosi-jade-carrycot-car-seat-3way-fi.final: I hope you've enjoyed this review. Let's get strollin'...
pros: Part of the 3way Maxi Cosi Series
pros-descr: ADAC tested this car seat in 2019. The result made this car seat to the best car seat so far with 1.5 point ('very good' category in ADAC). This car seat spreads the forces on the entire body of your baby. The baby's head is in the center of the car maximizing the side impact protection and protected by a head inlay.
Complies with the highest safetz standards, the seat categorization is based on the newest rules meaning it is based on the size of the child
Considering it's a carrycot, your child can sleep with a straight back properly.
No need to wake up your baby to transfer from car to stroller

If you love Maxi cosi and your toddler car seat is goind to be Maxi Cosi as well, then it's worth to buy. This system is a solution from birth up to approx 4 years in combination with 3WayFix (FamilyFix3), Pebble Plus and Pearl Pro i-Size. 

 Jade is compatible with strollers like Leona, Adorra2, Adorra, Street and Lila SP.
cons-descr: Since it can be mounted on an Isofix base across the direction of travel thus it takes up two seats.
It's almost 6 kg, so after giving birth, it's not so easy to lift up with your child.
You can use it when your child longer than 40 cm and less than 70 cm or less then 9 kg.
Considering the short life span, then price is a bit more than it should be.

cybex-gazelle-s2-impartial-review.title: An honest, impartial review about Cybex Gazelle S2 after 1.5 years of usage
cybex-gazelle-s2-impartial-review.subtitle: Dimensions, setups, pros and cons with 2 children under 3
cybex-gazelle-s2-impartial-review.intro: A Cybex Gazelle S2 stroller can be a great help in everyday life with two toddlers under 3 years old. Like everything in life, it has its advantages and disadvantages, but fundamentally, among the double strollers available on the market, it is an outstanding product that is worth its price. It can accommodate 1, 2, or even 3 children. It easily fits into the daily routine, perfect for afternoon naps, playing, lighter terrains, parks, urban streets, and shopping.
cybex-gazelle-s2-impartial-review.intro2: When I found out I was pregnant again, our first child was 1.5 years old. I was sure we would need a stroller that could be converted into a double. Comparable quality double strollers on the market were the Bugaboo Donkey 5, UppaBaby Vista V2, Thule Sleek, and Maxi Cosi Lila. After extensive review and information searching, we decided on the Cybex. After a year and a half, we didn't regret it, but I still felt a lack because when I wanted to compare strollers, I couldn't find any reviews or videos where every single dimension, every single parameter, and option were explained, showing the stroller with a child, pointing out every important detail.
cybex-gazelle-s2-impartial-review.warranty:
Cybex provides a non-transferable 2-year warranty upon presentation of the invoice and upon requesting it with the serial number. Facilitating complaint handling is if you register the product on the Cybex website. In Hungary, after the first year, there is a 2-year distributor's warranty where you have to prove that the manufacturer is at fault if something breaks. 

In the case of Gazelle, it is crucial that the serial number of the secondary seat is found on the original box packaging, not on the seat and frame bottom. If you do not keep or photograph it, you will not be able to claim the warranty in case of a problem with the secondary seat without a serial number. In our case, our Gazelle's frame with the primary seat is from Mamas&Papas, where they smoothly helped with the issue of the canopy sliding. I personally bought the secondary seat from the Mamilla store, where they did not draw my attention to the serial number on the box, so we left without it. Warranty handling is currently quite cumbersome with them.
cybex-gazelle-s2-impartial-review.what-is-it-for:
This stroller is a suitable choice for urban terrain with two toddlers under 3 years old, ideally purchased before the birth of the first child. Since it comes with a shopping basket, it's a great option for navigating the store with one child. (Someone recently asked me if any Gazelle owner ever uses the shopping basket. The situation is that it significantly facilitates shopping.)
I would recommend this stroller to parents who often need to travel or organize activities alone with two small children. When the older child is around 2 years old and prone to wander off, having such assistance can be invaluable. For me, visits to the zoo, wildlife parks, and beach strolls were much more reassuring because my older child couldn't suddenly run off in busier areas when I was alone with them.
If you intend to put it in the trunk of a car, a Fiat 500 won't be enough; the stroller measures 83.57 x 64.52 x 30.99 cm when folded, so at least an estate car trunk will be necessary.

When we started using it, my older child was 2 years old and 92 cm tall, while the younger one was 3 months old. Currently, my older child is over 3 years old and 104 cm tall. As seen in the picture, once we reach the seat's height capacity, our journey with the double stroller for two children will end. Considering that the stroller with 1 sports seat weighs 12.88 kg, I'll definitely be looking for a lighter alternative for my daughter from this point on.
pros: Compact fold with 2 sport seat units
pros-descr: Its most important advantage is that it can be converted into a sibling stroller, yet behaves just like a normal stroller when transporting one child. With one child seat attached, it's super easy to maneuver, handles obstacles well, can be easily lifted over a curb, and has a huge lower basket capacity and load capacity.

One of its best features is that the seat cover and sun canopy are washable in the washing machine, under the appropriate conditions. Currently, this is quite extraordinary on the market as many stroller manufacturers do not allow the stroller cover to be washed in the washing machine. What's more, removing the cover is child's play.
The sun canopy can be expanded to a truly enormous size and can really effectively shield the child when they want to hide or sleep, even providing almost complete coverage in a reclined position.

The adjustability of the sun canopy's height is a very good idea, allowing the seat to be used for a longer period by the older child, although the solution itself is not well thought out, as the canopy connector can slide on the rail after a while.
The harness tightening system on the S2 model is easily adjustable with one hand to fit the child's size.
With a small age gap, the older child is not yet reliable in busy traffic conditions. In such cases, the stroller is incredibly helpful as both children sit safely in it.
The stroller can be fold with 2 seat units as well.
cons: Peek-a-boo window without any means of fastening
The two seats are not interchangeable
Folding might succeed only once every leap year
cons-descr: One drawback for me is that the peek-a-boo window cannot be fastened in any way, neither with Velcro nor with magnets. This was annoying from the start because even a slight breeze would blow wind onto the child's head.
The sun canopy connector slides on the two outer frames of the seat, but this connector becomes loose after 1.5 years of use.
One of my biggest frustrations is the incomprehensible harness sewn onto the seat. We have a beautiful Makaszka footmuff, but it's unusable with this type of harness.
In single child mode, the stroller's huge lower basket turns into a literal rainwater collector in the rain, making it impossible to put anything there unless we want it washed...

It's possible we got a bad production batch, but the seat recline adjustment button got stuck and broke in 3 out of 2 cases, fortunately still within the first 14 days, so we returned it. The stroller we received for the third time has been flawless, and we haven't had any issues with this button since.

If both seats are forward-facing, the child sitting in the upper seat barely has any legroom. If the two seats are facing each other, the taller child's legs won't fit comfortably in the upper seat, making it uncomfortable for them to sit.

If there isn't an extremely small age gap between the two children, then the double child mode will only be usable for barely 1 year, as the older child won't comfortably fit in the seat. It's worth mentioning that although the manufacturer claims it can be used up to 4 years old, in reality, it's more like the beginning of the third year.

The seat received with the stroller and the secondary seat are not interchangeable; only the primary seat can fit into the lower adapter. (If you want to maintain the warranty. If this is not important to you, or if it's already out of warranty, and it bothers you that you can't swap the seats, you just need to grind down one small protruding piece of plastic on the connector of the secondary seat, and voilà, it's done. The same applies to the upper shopping basket.
In the vast majority of cases, folding the stroller requires a lot of patience and sometimes brute force.
It's weird that in 2023/2024 still not a basic feature to make the carrycot breezy. i.e. ABC Design made its Salsa 4 carrycot's ventilation in a proper way.
important-notes: Do not forget to register your new Gazelle on Cybex online website
Save the serial number for second seat from the BOX!!!
Do not fully let the footrest of the lower sports seat to avoid problems
cybex-gazelle-s2-impartial-review.dimension-title: Seat dimensions, Gazelle S2 in a RAV4 580-liter trunk
cybex-gazelle-s2-impartial-review.differences-title: Cybex Gazelle S vs Gazelle S2
cybex-gazelle-s2-impartial-review.differences: Apart from the color of the seats, the biggest difference in the upgraded version is the harness tightening system, which the S2 model 'inherits' from the Mios 3, ePriam 2, and Priam 4 models.
cybex-gazelle-s2-impartial-review.end: The Gazelle S2 is a brilliantly conceived and designed stroller that can serve the family for a long time, even as a travel system, if this stroller is the first one purchased. It handles two children exceptionally well, giving parents a solid workout. It's not particularly suited for stairs or inclines, as that's not its primary purpose. If the family plans to have at least two young children with a small age difference, it's worth investing in the Gazelle S2.
cybex-gazelle-s2-impartial-review.final: I hope you've enjoyed this review. Let's get strollin'...

doona-x-stroller-carseat-combo-review-20.title: A detailed, impartial review about Doona X car seat stroller combo
doona-x-stroller-carseat-combo-review-20.subtitle: Dimensions, setups, pros and cons
doona-x-stroller-carseat-combo-review-20.intro:
When it comes to choosing baby gear, parents often seek products that combine safety, convenience, and style. The Doona Infant Car Seat Stroller has gained significant popularity for its unique features and innovative design. But is it the right choice for you? 

 Doona X represents the new generation of the Doona Car Seat & Stroller, offering three recline positions: Sit, Relax, and Lay Back. This feature allows your child to lie down and relax comfortably. Like the Doona i, it meets the European i-Size safety regulation (R-129) and includes an adjustable harness and headrest. The Doona X also boasts patented shock absorbers and a smooth-release system for a smoother, safer ride, along with the Doona SIP add-on for enhanced side-impact protection.

 While the Doona+ and Doona i were available, I didn’t find the brand relevant to my needs. Living in the capital, our main modes of transportation within the city are buses, the metro, and occasionally taxis. With my first child, we rarely used a stroller, preferring a baby carrier (slings). These parameters suggested that the Doona+ or Doona i would be perfect for us. However, I couldn’t overlook the fact that the child couldn’t lie flat in the stroller, and the wheel suspension wasn’t the best.
doona-x-stroller-carseat-combo-review-20.warranty: Doona provides a non-transferable 2-year warranty upon presentation of the invoice and upon requesting it with the serial number. Facilitating complaint handling is if you register the product on the Doona website.
doona-x-stroller-carseat-combo-review-20.what-is-it-for:
This stroller is a suitable choice for urban terrain with two toddlers under 3 years old, ideally purchased before the birth of the first child. Since it comes with a shopping basket, it's a great option for navigating the store with one child. (Someone recently asked me if any Gazelle owner ever uses the shopping basket. The situation is that it significantly facilitates shopping.)
I would recommend this stroller to parents who often need to travel or organize activities alone with two small children. When the older child is around 2 years old and prone to wander off, having such assistance can be invaluable. For me, visits to the zoo, wildlife parks, and beach strolls were much more reassuring because my older child couldn't suddenly run off in busier areas when I was alone with them.
If you intend to put it in the trunk of a car, a Fiat 500 won't be enough; the stroller measures 83.57 x 64.52 x 30.99 cm when folded, so at least an estate car trunk will be necessary.

When we started using it, my older child was 2 years old and 92 cm tall, while the younger one was 3 months old. Currently, my older child is over 3 years old and 104 cm tall. As seen in the picture, once we reach the seat's height capacity, our journey with the double stroller for two children will end. Considering that the stroller with 1 sports seat weighs 12.88 kg, I'll definitely be looking for a lighter alternative for my daughter from this point on.
pros: Full recline feature, with 3 positions - Sit, Relax, Lay Back
New canopy design with textile zipper connection
Improved side impact protection, Doona SIP add on
pros-descr:
These elevated features provide comfort and convenience, ensuring a seamless experience while exploring the world. 

[Image source: doona.com]
Complies with the highest safetz standards, the seat categorization is based on the newest rules meaning it is based on the size of the child
[Image source: doona.com]

New canopy design with textile zipper connection compared to textile push button connection by Doona i and Doona +. 

 [Image source: doona.com]
Shock absorbent mechanism is now introduced for wheels finally.

Improved side impact protection, Doona SIP add on. 

[Image source: doona.com]
cons-descr: Like other Doona models, the Doona X may be heavier compared to traditional infant car seats due to its integrated stroller mechanism. This added weight can make it more challenging to carry, especially for petite individuals.
Some users may find the push handle of the Doona X too low with its 101 cm, especially taller individuals. This can lead to discomfort during extended periods of pushing the stroller
The Doona X, like other Doona products, is an investment. Its dual functionality and innovative features come at a premium price point, which may not be feasible for all budgets.

Unlike some other stroller brands, the Doona X may not have ADAC certification, which is a safety standard recognized in certain regions. This lack of certification may raise concerns for parents seeking additional reassurance regarding safety.
important-notes: Do not forget to register your new Gazelle on Cybex online website
Save the serial number for second seat from the BOX!!!
Do not fully let the footrest of the lower sports seat to avoid problems
doona-x-stroller-carseat-combo-review-20.dimension-title: Seat dimensions, Gazelle S2 in a RAV4 580-liter trunk
doona-x-stroller-carseat-combo-review-20.differences-title: Differenced among Doona X, Doona i and  Dooona +
doona-x-stroller-carseat-combo-review-20.differences:
Recline: Only Doona X offers three recline positions - Sit, Relax, and Lay Back - providing more options for your child's comfort. 

i-Size compliancy: Only Doona X and Doona i is R129 certified while the classic Doona + is R44 certified. 

Canopy design: While the new Doona X has a zipper connection, Doona i and Doona + have a textile push button connection. 

As for the wheels, only Doona X has shock absorbent mechanism.
doona-x-stroller-carseat-combo-review-20.end:
Two months ago, the Doona X was introduced. If I were expecting my first child now, my perspective would be entirely different. The Doona X can recline in three positions, has an adjustable harness and ISOFIX compatibility, improved suspension, and a smoother transformation process into a stroller. These features are highly appealing. 
Currently, my hesitation stems from the lack of ADAC safety certification and the push handle height, which, at 101 cm, is too low for my husband. In comparison, an Orbit Baby or Stokke stroller can have handles adjusted up to 135 cm, which makes a significant difference. 
Overall, Doona’s popularity and market relevance are undeniable and clearly on the rise.
doona-x-stroller-carseat-combo-review-20.final: I hope you've enjoyed this review. Let's get strollin'...

bugaboo-butterfly-review-2024.title: The Bugaboo Butterfly: Redefining Urban Mobility for Parents
bugaboo-butterfly-review-2024.subtitle: Dimensions, setups, pros and cons
bugaboo-butterfly-review-2024.intro:
Bugaboo Butterfly appear in early of 2023 and defeated Yoyo2 ultra compact lightweight stroller. 

Renowned for its commitment to high-quality, functional, and stylish baby products, Bugaboo has once again pushed the boundaries with the Butterfly, a stroller designed to cater to the dynamic needs of modern families. 

 This article delves into the features, benefits, and unique aspects of the Bugaboo Butterfly, highlighting why it stands out in the crowded market of baby strollers.
pros-descr: With its 63 cm height, this stroller wins the competition regarding seat height. It's quite a choice for tall toddlers.
This stroller fold itself within 1 second! [image source: bugaboo.com]
Bugaboo provides 4-year warranty. It's much better compared to Cybex 2-year warranty.
With a car seat adapter, it can be a travel system as well to ease your travels with cars.
It's only 7.3 kg, so it's much lighter, then the others in this category.
Bugaboo is trying to go green with their strollers materials.
Usually lightweight strollers has a tiny basket with 2 or 3 kg storage capacity. Butterfly can store even 8 kg!
cons: Bumper bar not included, need to buy separately
cons-descr: Like Cybex, Bugaboo does the same with accessories. You need to buy anything separately on a high price... [image source: bugaboo.com]
While it's a cool stroller, de wheels are tiny, so probably you will have some difficulties with bigger potholes or terrains.
Butterfly seat cannot be lie-flat unfortunately.
Butterfly seat cannot be configured to provide straight sit up for your toddler. There are kids who cannot stand strollers with this issue.
bugaboo-butterfly-review-2024.end: The Bugaboo Butterfly is more than just a stroller; it is a testament to the innovative spirit of Bugaboo and its dedication to enhancing the lives of parents and children. With its compact design, ease of use, superior comfort, and eco-friendly credentials, the Butterfly is a standout choice for urban families. about-us.title: Who I am and why is this page even exists?
about-us.intro: Welcome to my website, your ultimate resource for stroller and car seat comparisons and informative blog posts.
about-us.who-we-are: I am a mother of two young children, an economist, a civil engineer, and a software developer. With such a diverse background, I bring a unique perspective to the world of parenting products. My journey into creating this website started from my own experiences and challenges as a parent.
about-us.our-story: When my children were born, I found it incredibly difficult to locate comprehensive information to thoroughly compare strollers. The same issue arose with car seats — there was no single source that provided detailed comparisons based on the most crucial criteria. This frustration sparked the idea to create a website that would fill this gap and help other parents make informed decisions with ease.
about-us.our-mission: My mission is to provide parents with reliable, detailed, and unbiased information about strollers and car seats. I aim to simplify the process of selecting the best products for your children by offering in-depth comparisons and expert advice.
about-us.my-work: Creating this website has been a monumental task. Every aspect of it, from gathering the smallest details to developing the website itself, has been done single-handedly. I am committed to ensuring that every piece of information is accurate and useful. My goal is to save you time and effort by presenting all the important facts in one place, so you can make the best choices for your family.
about-us.what-i-offer:
- Stroller Comparisons: Detailed reviews and comparisons of the latest strollers on the market, highlighting features, pros and cons, and value for money. 

 - Car Seat Comparisons: Comprehensive analysis of various car seats, focusing on safety, ease of installation, comfort, and price. 

- Blog Posts: Regularly updated articles offering tips, advice, and insights on parenting, product reviews, and the latest trends in child safety and comfort.
about-us.thank-you: Thank you for visiting my website. I hope you find the information here helpful and empowering. If you have any questions or need further assistance, please don't hesitate to contact me. Together, we can make parenting just a little bit easier.

gdpr.title: GDPR Settings - Privacy Policy
gdpr.intro:
At Strollerina, we are committed to safeguarding your privacy and ensuring the security of
                            your
                            personal information. This Privacy Policy outlines how we collect, use, disclose, and manage
                            your
                            data in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
gdpr.data-collection-details:
We may collect personal information such as your name, address, email address, phone number,
                            and
                            payment details when you make a purchase or interact with our website. We may also collect
                            information about your device, browser, and browsing behavior through cookies and similar
                            technologies.
gdpr.use-of-data-details: We use the information we collect to process your orders, communicate with you, improve our products and services, and personalize your experience. We may also use your data for marketing purposes, but only with your consent.
gdpr.data-sharing-details:
We may share your personal information with trusted third parties such as shipping carriers
                            and
                            payment processors to fulfill your orders. We may also disclose your data when required by
                            law or to
                            protect our rights and interests.
gdpr.data-security-details:
We implement security measures to protect your personal information from unauthorized
                            access,
                            disclosure, alteration, or destruction. However, please be aware that no method of
                            transmission over
                            the internet or electronic storage is 100% secure.
gdpr.your-rights-details:
You have the right to access, correct, or delete your personal information. You can also
                            object to
                            the processing of your data, restrict its use, or request its transfer to another party. To
                            exercise
                            these rights or if you have any questions about our Privacy Policy, please contact us.
gdpr.approval:
By using our website and providing your personal information, you consent to the collection,
                            use,
                            and disclosure of your data as described in this Privacy Policy. We may update this Policy
                            from time
                            to time, so please review it periodically for changes.

cybex.intro:
Cybex is a leading manufacturer of child safety products, including child car seats, strollers, baby carriers, and kids furniture. 
 
 Founded in 2005 by Martin Pos in Hong Kong as CYBEX Industrial Ltd., the company has since become synonymous with innovation and quality in the industry. 

In 2014, Cybex was acquired by Goodbaby International, a Chinese child safety manufacturer, further solidifying its position as a global leader in child safety.
cybex.history:
With locations in Hong Kong, Kulmbach, Bayreuth, and Prague, Cybex sells its products internationally, catering to modern urban lifestyles. At the heart of the brand is the CYBEX D.S.F. Innovation Principle, which combines unique Design, unsurpassed Safety, and intelligent Functionality. This approach has led to the development of award-winning products like the rear-facing Sirona car seat, earning Cybex no less than fifteen Red Dot Design Awards.

 Cybex is not only recognized for its commitment to safety but also for its innovative designs and fashion-forward approach. By constantly challenging the status quo, Cybex has redefined the industry, offering products that seamlessly blend safety, design, and function. 

The merger with Goodbaby International in 2014 further strengthened Cybex's position, leveraging Goodbaby's extensive research, development, and manufacturing capabilities.

European chic meets German pedantry in Cybex products, catering to modern parents who prioritize both style and safety. With a commitment to quality and safety endorsed by European testing organizations, Cybex continues to set new benchmarks in child safety, starting with its pioneering child car seats in 2000.
cybex.important-note:
Do not forget to register your Cybex products now​ and become
 a CYBEX Club member to unlock your exclusive benefits.
cybex.title: Innovating Child Safety with European Chic

baby_jogger.intro:
In the bustling world of parenthood, few tools are as indispensable as the trusty stroller. From leisurely walks in the park to navigating crowded city streets, a reliable stroller is every parent's best friend. Among the plethora of options available, one brand stands out for its commitment to quality, innovation, and convenience: Baby Jogger.

 Since its inception, Baby Jogger has been synonymous with durability and functionality. Founded in 1984 by Phil Baechler, a father who wanted a solution for jogging with his infant son, the brand has evolved into a global leader in the stroller industry. What sets Baby Jogger apart is its relentless pursuit of perfection, continually refining its designs to meet the ever-changing needs of modern parents.
baby_jogger.history:
Innovative Design Features
 At the heart of every Baby Jogger stroller lies a dedication to innovation. The brand's engineers work tirelessly to incorporate cutting-edge features that enhance both the parent and child's experience. From the patented Quick-Fold Technology™ for effortless folding to the adjustable handlebars for ergonomic comfort, every detail is meticulously crafted with the end user in mind.

One hallmark feature of Baby Jogger strollers is their versatility. Whether you're a fitness enthusiast hitting the trails or a city dweller navigating tight spaces, there's a Baby Jogger stroller tailored to your lifestyle. With options ranging from compact urban models to rugged all-terrain designs, parents can find the perfect match for their unique needs. 

 Eco-Friendly Initiatives
In an era of increasing environmental consciousness, Baby Jogger is committed to sustainability. The brand actively seeks out eco-friendly materials and manufacturing processes to minimize its carbon footprint. From recyclable packaging to energy-efficient facilities, every effort is made to reduce environmental impact without compromising quality.
baby_jogger.title: Exploring the Ultimate Convenience: The Baby Jogger Stroller Brand

1.reviewer-intro: The Baby Jogger Summit X3 has the price of a high-end best stroller but failed to perform well enough in our tests to justify the hefty price tag. Without the features and performance necessary to function as a jogging stroller, it is hard to find a reason to purchase it. It earned a 4 out of 10 for run-ability, making it a product we think parents will be disappointed if running is their plan. Compared to the competition, which includes strollers with higher scores and better performance coupled with lower list prices, it is a no-brainer to say we do not recommend this stroller.

2.review-name-title: Baby Jogger Summit X3 Stroller Review
2.reviewer-intro: Baby Jogger has been making the Summit X3 for years and years – and this particular model has been the same since 2016. Ironically, the Summit X3 is Baby Jogger’s only jogging stroller – HA! Baby Jogger was purchased by Graco around 2017, and it’s kinda good to see that Graco hasn’t “Graco-ized” this model, like they have the City Mini.

3.review-name-title: Baby Jogger City Sights, An Impartial Review: Mechanics, Comfort, Use

4.review-name-title: Baby Jogger City Select 2 Double Review
4.reviewer-intro: The Baby Jogger City Select 2 Double is an inline stroller with somewhat stadium-style seating, included in our best double stroller review. This stroller offers multiple seating configurations, including two toddler seats in various directions and two car seats with adapters. The Select 2 has good size storage that is easy to access and brakes that are foot-friendly and easy to set and release. Unfortunately, this stroller is long and harder to maneuver, requiring a thoughtful approach and planning ahead. The fold is ridiculously bulky, and if you want to fit it almost anywhere, you'll have to remove the second seat to do it. The most frustrating is how close the toddler seats are to one another. If you use both, the front seat can't recline without hitting the child behind than, and the child behind them can kick the front seat at will. It seems like a design flaw in our minds, and the best strollers do this style better. Overall, the City Select 2 is an okay stroller, but it didn't meet the performance of the competition in our tests.

5.review-name-title: Baby Jogger City Mini GT2 Review
5.reviewer-intro: The Baby Jogger City Mini GT2 is a below-average full-size stroller that didn't stand out outside of being lightweight and compact when folded. However, even that isn't enough to make it one we think is a good fit for most families. This stroller has remained essentially unchanged for over 10 years. The features and functions feel dated compared to newer designs, and the functionality is somewhat lacking in most tests. The smaller wheels had trouble both on and off-road, and the narrow wheelbase left it somewhat tippy when trying to negotiate tight turns. The storage bin has a bar that goes across, limiting access, and the seatback can't be lifted with one hand. Overall, it is a somewhat dull stroller that can get the job done, but we think there are higher-performing options that parents and passengers will enjoy more.

bob.intro:
When it comes to outdoor exploration with your little ones, the BOB Stroller brand stands out as a beacon of rugged durability and unmatched performance. Since its inception, BOB has been synonymous with quality, offering parents the ultimate in off-road mobility for their active lifestyles. 

 The BOB Legacy
BOB, short for Beast of Burden, was founded in 1994 by two fathers who shared a passion for outdoor adventures with their children. Frustrated by the lack of suitable strollers for rough terrain, they set out to design a solution that could keep up with their active lifestyles. The result was the BOB Sport Utility Stroller, a game-changer in the world of all-terrain strollers.
bob.history:
Built for Adventure
At the heart of every BOB stroller lies a commitment to rugged performance. Whether you're tackling rocky trails, sandy beaches, or snowy landscapes, BOB strollers are up to the challenge. With features like adjustable suspension systems, pneumatic tires, and a lightweight yet durable frame, these strollers glide effortlessly over any terrain, providing a smooth ride for both parent and child. 
Safety and Comfort

While BOB strollers excel in off-road performance, they never compromise on safety and comfort. Each stroller undergoes rigorous testing to ensure compliance with the highest safety standards. From secure harness systems to padded seats and adjustable canopies, BOB strollers prioritize the well-being of your little one, allowing you to explore with peace of mind.

Versatility at its Core
One of the hallmarks of the BOB brand is its versatility. Whether you're a dedicated runner, a weekend hiker, or simply enjoy long walks in the park, there's a BOB stroller to suit your needs. With options ranging from jogging strollers to all-terrain models, parents can find the perfect match for their active lifestyle.
In 2011, Britax expanded its portfolio with the acquisition of BOB Gear, a renowned brand of jogging pushchairs and accessories. This strategic move further solidified Britax's position in the childcare industry, offering parents a comprehensive range of products to meet their needs.
bob.title: Exploring the BOB Stroller Brand

0.reviewer-intro: The @Bobgear revolution flex 3.0 is a heavy duty running stroller with a lot to offer. Check out this review to see if it will be the right jogging stroller for you

1.review-name-title: BOB Gear Wayfinder Jogging Stroller Review & Comparison
1.reviewer-intro: by @mbeansdotcom: Introducing the Wayfinder, @bobgearus’s latest addition to their running strollers lineup. Despite its compact size, this stroller packs the same quality as the ultra-popular Bob Alterrain stroller, making it the perfect choice for parents who value both functionality and aesthetics.

2.reviewer-intro: The BOB Revolution Flex 3.0 is a tried and true favorite full-size stroller crossover jogger. The stroller is easy to push and turn on and off the road. It has a locking swivel front wheel and pneumatic tires that make it comfy for the pusher and the passenger. We like the utilitarian nature of this stroller and think it is a great off-roading option for those who like to adventure off the sidewalk. However, it can do double duty for everyday errands as well, with large storage, nap-able seating, and features that benefit everyone. However, it is big and clunky when folded, and folding is a two-hand deal, while other competitors are one and stand by themselves. It also lacks the sleekness of other joggers and could be more stroller than you need. Overall, it is an option for those who love the outdoors and still need something for everyday life.

4.reviewer-intro: The BOB Alterrain Pro is the newest option presented by BOB, famous for the Revolution Flex. It has high-end features and a new design that aligns it with some of the nicer competition. The new stroller features a streamlined folding process, covered storage, taunt canopy, and new suspension that reminds us of the Thule Urban Glide 2. It still features a locking swivel front wheel, adjustable tracking and handlebar, and an aluminum frame. Unfortunately, the heavier weight and larger size mean it struggled in testing compared to thebest jogging strollers and we experienced more rolling resistance over the competition. Overall, this is a nice stroller with some impressive features, but for the price, we think there are better options to be had that will save you money.

3.reviewer-intro:
Designed to provide a smooth, cushy ride at higher speeds and on uneven terrain, jogging strollers are preferred by runners as well as by caregivers who simply appreciate how easy they are to push and maneuver in everyday use.
After testing 18 models, we found that the Thule Urban Glide 3 is the best jogging stroller for people who are traversing mostly paved terrain (though this model can also handle the occasional off-road detour).
If you’re looking for a slightly narrower jogging stroller, with rugged wheels designed to handle off-road terrain, you may prefer the BOB Gear Wayfinder, our also-great pick.

5.review-name-title: An All-Terrain Double Jogging Stroller With Great Reviews
5.reviewer-intro: Typically when studying customer reviews, you see a fairly even distribution of likes and dislikes: 1 star, 5 stars, and everything in between; not so much with this stroller.

However, this stroller has a bulky fold with no fold lock, and we don't think it will fit in everyone's car without dismantling it. britax_römer.intro:
For over 50 years, Britax has been at the forefront of child safety technology, earning the trust of families worldwide. What began as a venture into automotive safety equipment in 1938 has blossomed into a leading manufacturer of childcare safety products, including car seats and strollers. 

A Journey of Innovation
The roots of Britax trace back to its inception as a manufacturer of automotive safety accessories in the late 1930s. Over the decades, Britax diversified its portfolio, delving into aircraft interiors, car mirrors, and eventually, childcare safety products. In the 1960s, Britax made significant strides in safety technology, introducing the kite-mark BS 3254 for car seats and pioneering the inertia reel seat belt, a revolutionary innovation that saved lives.
britax_römer.history:
Expansion and Acquisition
 Britax's commitment to safety led to strategic acquisitions, including RÖMER in Germany in 1973 and Safe-n-Sound in Australia in 1989, bolstering its position as a global leader in child safety. These acquisitions expanded Britax's reach, bringing its innovative products to new markets across Europe and Oceania.

 Setting Standards for Safety
Throughout its history, Britax has been instrumental in setting safety standards for the industry. The introduction of the Isofix (LATCH) system in collaboration with Volkswagen in 1997 revolutionized child seat installation, enhancing safety and ease of use for parents worldwide. Britax's dedication to safety is evident in its patent portfolio, boasting over 180 granted patents in the United States alone.
A Commitment to Quality
Britax's reputation for quality and reliability is unmatched. From its early days manufacturing automotive safety equipment to its current lineup of childcare safety products, Britax sets the standard for excellence. Each product undergoes rigorous testing to ensure compliance with the highest safety standards, providing parents with peace of mind.
The BOB Gear Acquisition

In 2011, Britax expanded its portfolio with the acquisition of BOB Gear, a renowned brand of jogging pushchairs and accessories. This strategic move further solidified Britax's position in the childcare industry, offering parents a comprehensive range of products to meet their needs.
britax_römer.important-note:
Certified B Corp™

Being B Corp certified means we’re committed to making a positive impact on the world for future generations. Here’s how it’ll keep us pushing to do even better.
britax_römer.title: The Legacy: Britax Stroller Brand

hauck.history:
hauck – a history of over 100 years of agility

1923 Originally, the company was founded by Felix Hauck as a basketry​.

1950er The product range has been in constant development. The bassinets were followed by footmuffs.​

1960er hauck was the first nursery brand to source products from outside Germany.​

1970s The collection is expanded to include cots and prams, which very quickly become sought-after nationwide.

1980er hauck became the first licensee of Disney in the German nursery segment. Together, hauck and Disney will celebrate their 100-year anniversary in 2023.​

1990er hauck proved again the ability to re-invent itself, this time as a pioneer in channel distribution: In the 90s, it started to supply the department stores KARSTADT and KAUFHOF.​

2000er hauck was the first company in the industry to sell its baby and children's products through amazon.de, shortly after the platform went online.​

2010er Other product premieres such as our various value sets further improved hauck’s leading position on the market.​

2020er An investment of the private equity company AVEDON Capital Partners B.V. now aims to further develop the business model and accelerate the growth.​ The corporate group is growing by adding the sourcing company Euret and the trading platform babyartikel.

2023 hauck is celebrating the 100th anniversary and expanding the product portfolio to become the most caring newborn companion with a 360-degree product portfolio around babies.

Mamas & Papas' journey began with a commitment to creating products that make parenting easier and more enjoyable. Founded in [1995], the brand quickly gained recognition for its innovative designs and attention to detail. With a focus on quality craftsmanship and premium materials, Mamas & Papas products are trusted by parents around the world to provide the best for their children.Mamas & Papas is a UK-based nursery brand and manufacturer supplying prams, pushchairs, baby products, furniture and maternity wear. It was established in Huddersfield in 1981 by David and Luisa Scacchetti, both of Italian ancestry, whose initial aim was to bring Italian design to the UK baby buggy market. They started the business with a range of coloured corduroy prams imported from Italy. They sold through one local shop of their own and through supplying other stores, until deciding to become a retail brand in 1998. For most of its existence, the business was privately owned.
By 2011, Mamas & Papas was described as the "UK's bestselling nursery brand". In 2014, the business embarked on cost-cutting associated with a Company Voluntary Arrangement (CVA). Store closures were considered [6] but were avoided by the CVA.

Designing innovative and award-winning products for over 25 years, our iconic Kiwi brand enables parents all around the world to live life without limit.

peg_perego.intro: Peg Perego, the Italian company founded in 1949 by Giuseppe Perego, revolutionized the market by designing carriages and strollers using “rubberized fabric” instead of sheet metal and wicker which were commonly in use and providing everyone with child care products that until that time had a limited market due to high costs.Avant-garde, attention to market changes and foresight have built a successful company over time which is known all over the world for its original ideas in the fields of infant care and toys, which are always of the highest quality, respect international safety regulations and are up to speed with the expectations of the modern mom.The campaign “Mamma in Italy” confirms the company’s creed in the Italian way of production which has earned the trust of mother’s for its quality: whoever loves “Made in Italy” looks for style, elegance, details and safety, quality ideas which Peg Perego constantly refers to when designing and creating its products.For Peg Perego, Made in Italy means “to continue doing only what we know how to do well”, says Lucio Perego, the company’s CEO, meaning to continue cultivating the patrimony of skills of Peg’s Italian production and enriching it with modern and avant-garde processing methods.
peg_perego.history: The company has, in fact, supported its traditional spring season line of juvenile products (strollers, carriages, car seats and high chairs) with toy production, which has allowed using stable and optimal human resources. The integrated production offers closer quality control and an improvement in skills: from materials (fabric, rubber, metal) to the technology of complex and avant-garde production machinery. A team of experts supervises the entire production process to guarantee juvenile products.The compact and traditional organizational structure with a variety of tasks and taking care of the work environment with a great amount of attention given to the people consolidate company loyalty. The production facilities in Italy are: Arcore (Milan), San Donà di Piave (Venice), Ceggia (Venice), and add our international partners: Fort Wayne (USA), Toronto (Canada) Limeira SP (Brazil), for a total production surface area of 161.000 square meters.Peg Perego’s dynamic abilities can also been seen in recent creations: not only the building of a nursery dedicated to the founder, Giuseppe Perego, located in front of the offices and available for new mothers who work for the company, but also the reconstruction of the entire industrial area and the creation of a modern foodservice building for all of the employees.The site http://www.pegperego.com/, updated constantly, provides the trade and customers with all the new products, services and useful information needed when making an important purchase.We can talk about Peg Perego “System”: a way to produce characterized by research and experimentation, productive rigour, technical creativity and also a strong manufacturing culture which answers the client’s needs in terms of services and safety in purchasing child products.Only if the industry is able to translate new ideas into products that are able to “enter and withstand” the test of time, do these ideas take on a role in the usage culture: this is the case of Peg Perego’s Italian history.

ternx.intro:
TernX embodies our commitment to versatility and innovation, anchored in our mission to simplify traveling with kids. Inspired by the tern bird, celebrated for its agility, grace, and resilience, it serves as a powerful inspiration. Its small but packs a punch. Terns are adept at navigating various environments, from coastlines to open seas, embodying the spirit of versatility and adaptability that we aspire to embody on our journey.
The "X" in TernX represents the unknown, the potential for limitless growth and exploration. It symbolizes our commitment to pushing boundaries, challenging conventions, and constantly evolving to meet the ever changing needs of our community… plus we thought it sounded pretty cool.
ternx.history:
Building blocks of change
 With millions of requests for basic essentials including diapers, clothing, backpacks, cribs, shoes, soap, shampoo, and more, Baby2Baby relies on the support from sponsors to stock their warehouse with high-need items, which are then distributed to the children Baby2Baby serves across the country.
At the heart of our mission lies the empowerment of parents with young children. That's why we couldn't envision a more fitting partner than Baby2Baby, whose values align closely with our own. TernX is proud to be a sponsor of
Baby2Baby. 

Sustainability
We’re committed to offset our CO2 emissions and thrilled to announce our collaboration with Tree-Nation, a global reforestation platform with an aim to plant 1 trillion trees by 2050.

From the air we breathe, the water we drink, and the food we eat, the natural world is an incredible wonder that inspires us all.

Together, we're not only creating a greener future but also supporting communities and biodiversity around the world with the Forest of TernX.
ternx.important-note: from carry on luggage to stroller in seconds.
ternx.title: from carry on luggage to stroller in seconds.

thule.intro:
Whether it’s exploring the spectacular nature of the great outdoors or traveling the world with family and friends, we all have a passion for enjoying an active life. 
At Thule, we share your desire to spend more time enjoying our passions – which means less time worrying about how to bring all the stuff we need. For more than 75 years, Thule has been creating solutions to simplify life’s adventures. We are committed to developing smart, stylish products that are environmentally sound, high quality, safe, and easy to use. All so you can bring the things you care most about.Whatever your passion, whatever your pursuit.Wherever you ́re going, whatever you ́re bringing.
With Thule, you're free to live your active life to the full.
thule.history:
1942: Thule is founded by Eric Thulin, Sweden
1962: We introduced the Thule ski rack – the first Thule product for carrying your sports gear
1964: We introduced the Thule Roof Basket – a true innovation with its flexible fastening solution for easier mounting
1977: The first Thule Ski Box TB-11 is launched. World-famous alpine skier Ingemar Stenmark becomes the brand ambassador
1983: Surfboard carriers launched and world-famous surfer Robby Naish becomes a brand ambassador
1992: Launch of the first towbar-mounted bike carrier
2001: The year when you can transport your kayaks on Thule Hull-a-Port Kayak Carrier
2005: We introduced bike carriers and awnings for RV products
2010: You can travel the world with Thule Crossover
2011: As an active family you can now have an active life with your kids with multifunctional trailers
2014: and in we introduced our jogging strollers & child bike seats
2015: You can go hiking and trekking with our technical backpacks
2018: It was time to elevate the adventure with our rooftop tent
thule.important-note: The ultimate bike trailer, jogger, and stroller
thule.title: Bring your life ®

uppa_baby.intro:
UPPAbaby® was started when we became new parents, just like you. We now have three kids running around our house, but we like to think our family extends far beyond these four walls. Our customers are like true family members to us— every single one of them. As we continue to expand and evolve, our dedication has only grown stronger. We are still every bit committed to being the best at what we do. For our family, and now for yours.
UPPAbaby was born in 2006 out of necessity and opportunity. It all came together when we had our second child but still couldn’t find the right baby gear to fit our needs. We wondered why the only options were either mass-produced and cheaply made or impractical and complicated with lengthy instruction manuals to operate. We were confident other parents wanted more, too.
uppa_baby.history:
We wanted to make a stroller for parents that made their lives easier and better. We knew that as long as we took one step after another in the right direction, we could create a high-performance stroller that met and exceeded the needs of parents – all while letting them maintain the sense of style they’ve always had.
Over the next few years, UPPAbaby grew organically and today, we’re proud to say the UPPAbaby family employs more than 175 people, selling strollers, car seats, accessories, and juvenile gear worldwide! Thank you for your continued support. We are so glad you’re here.– The Monahans
uppa_baby.title: welcome to the family.

valco_baby.intro: Valco Baby, a brand dedicated to creating practical and stylish strollers, has been a favorite among parents since its inception. With a focus on innovation and design excellence, Valco Baby offers parents elegant and functional solutions for their little ones. From compact travel strollers to full-size urban strollers, Valco Baby has something for every family.
valco_baby.history: Valco Baby, an established Australian company with over 50 years of heritage, specializes in crafting nursery furniture, bouncy chairs, stands, doll prams, and related accessories. Valco's strollers and products are meticulously designed to exude modernity, integrate practical features, and ensure user-friendliness. Renowned for their lightweight construction, Valco strollers offer compactness and effortless portability. Despite their commitment to simplicity, Valco strollers provide comprehensive solutions for children from infancy through their stroller-free years. Notably, the Snap series, starting with the Snap 3 and Snap 4, has garnered widespread acclaim and popularity.
valco_baby.title: Presenting the all new...

veebee.intro:
Introducing vee🐝bee proudly made by Valco Baby
As a wholly owned Australian brand we are proud to deliver quality, practical, affordable and fun baby and nursery products for both parents and children Australia wide and internationally.
Our range includes just about anything for baby. From single and twin prams, to pram accessories, nursery ware (and almost everything in between).
You might have noticed the BabyInc™ & 123 Grow™ brands. These are all under our umbrella, striving to bring you quality baby products.
Our products can be found in all leading nursery and department stores across Australia and are now available online, direct to your door 🙂
veebee.history: VeeBee's journey began in [year], when the brand was founded with a mission to create childcare products that offer great value for money. Since then, VeeBee has become a favorite among parents, with its products being trusted for their reliability and affordability. With a commitment to providing practical solutions for modern families, VeeBee continues to innovate and create products that meet the needs of parents and children alike.

zoe.intro:
With over 40 years of experience in the baby industry, the founder of Zoe Stroller Brand embarked on a journey of innovation and consumer-centric approach in 2014. Starting Zoe as a passion project, the founder aimed to challenge the traditional retail model by directly connecting with consumers and delivering high-quality products tailored to their needs.
The decision to rebrand Zoe stemmed from its humble beginnings as a hobby, where branding considerations were minimal. Recognizing the importance of a distinct identity, the founder embraced a new logo characterized by whimsical letters and vibrant orange hues, reflecting the brand's cheerful and family-friendly ethos.
Over the years, Zoe has evolved from a passion project into a recognized name in the stroller industry, known for its commitment to innovation, quality, and direct-to-consumer approach. With a focus on providing fun and functional stroller solutions, Zoe continues to delight families with its colorful and whimsical designs.
zoe.history: ZOE's journey began in 2014, when the brand was founded with a mission to create strollers that are both lightweight and durable. Since then, ZOE has become a trusted name in the industry, with its products being loved by parents around the world for their quality and affordability. With a commitment to innovation and customer satisfaction, ZOE continues to push the boundaries of what is possible in childcare.
zoe.important-note: Parenting is a trip. Take it.
zoe.title: Parenting is a trip. Take it.
